SENT.plain: Four patients with acquired amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenic purpura, who had failed corticosteroids, intravenous immunoglobulin and cyclophosphamide therapy, were treated with antithymocyte globulin, followed by cyclosporin
Three patients achieved complete remission in 28-178 days and the response duration was 16-60 months from the beginning of treatment
One patient achieved a partial response for 2 months followed by myelodysplastic syndrome 5 months later
He died in 9 months due to intracerebral bleeding
